history.content:
I took that exact courseload as a freshman, and while manageable gradewise, I felt like I was doing myself a disservice as to how much time I could spend actually absorbing the material.

More perspective: @8129

I took that exact same courseload plus STAT134 as a freshman, and it was manageable but tough for sure--really forced me to manage my time better.

children.subject:
I also did all three. Although I think I did understand the material pretty well in all three, I spent a ton of time every week ensuring I did so (80+ hrs). Tbh if you care about having a social life I wouldn't recommend this schedule and would recommend switching either 16b or 70 (depending on whether you are more ee or cs focused), but if you don't and prioritize school the schedule really did help to do this to get ahead and take upper divs I wanted to take.

As for your question about whether you'll be able to learn enough to take related upper divs, I took 126 and 170 fa '18 (did 16b + 61b + 70 sp '18) and I got As in both, so I wouldn't worry about that.

+1 student answer. i did well in all 3, but in retrospect, i didn't deeply understand the material and spend enough time with course material that it internalized well. definitely would've helped for 170/later courses, but taking all 3 allows you to dive into upperdivs sooner.

history.content: Current EECS freshman. I've enrolled in 61B and 16B for Spring, but have been considering adding 70 too, mainly to get it done to take CS170 next Fall. Would taking these three classes together be manageable enough that I could meaningfully learn enough from 61b and 70 to do well in upper divs? Or would I be wasting my time in trying to squeeze them together?
history.subject: CS61B + CS70 + EE16B workload?
